content: this stunning afghan block is full of floral texture use it by itself or with other squares to crochet a warm blanket ***this crochet pattern is available for free on my website visit pattern website link above or you can download it here on ravelry as a print-optimized ad-free pdf *** **difficulty ** intermediate/advanced *techniques used post stitches shell stitches puff stitches popcorn stitches cluster stitches crochet in the back bar crochet in the back loop * **materials needed ** approximately 230 yards #4 worsted weight yarn in 4 colors of your choice i used red heart super saver ombré in coco 70 yards and anemone 30 yards red heart super saver in aran 70 yards and an off-brand worsted in a dusty pink 55 yards 6mm j hook or hook needed to obtain gauge yarn needle scissors stitch markers **stitches used ** chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet bphdc = back post half_double_crochet bpsc = back post single_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet fptr = front post treble_crochet **additional terms ** popcorn 3 double_crochet in same st take hook out of last double_crochet just worked and put it through top of first double_crochet grab loop from 3rd double_crochet and pull it through the first double_crochet puff st yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo insert hook into same stitch pull up a loop 2 more times yo and pull through all 7 loops single_crochet 2 together decrease invisible decrease insert hook through front loop of next 2 sts yo pull up a loop yo pull through 2 elizabeth stitch insert hook into st yo draw up a loop yo insert hook into same st draw up a loop yo pull through all 4 loops on hook these stitches should be as tall as a single_crochet stitch back bar of single_crochet look at the back of the stitch and locate the short bar that runs horizontal work all designated stitches for the round into this bar this is a different location than the back loop 2tr cluster 2tr cluster = yo hook twice insert hook into designated chain-space or stitch draw up a loop yo draw through 2 twice yo hook twice insert hook into same chain-space or stitch draw up a loop yo draw through 2 twice yo draw through 3 blo = back loop only st/sts = stitch/stitches **gauge ** circle should measure 5 1/2 across after round 7 **additional notes ** -chain 1 at beginning of round does not count as a stitch -unless otherwise indicated slip stitches are not counted as a stitch and are not worked into -mid-round color changes will be made by pulling a loop of the new color through the final 2 loops of a single_crochet double_crochet or treble_crochet stitch or the last 3 loops of a half_double_crochet stitch color changes at the beginning of a new round can be done with a chainless starting method
